<Notification>
If you have an idea for a new icon please follow our <PageLink path="/contribute/design/#contribute-icons">icon contribution guidelines</PageLink>.

All icons in the <PageLink path="/icons/">Maersk Icon Library</PageLink> follow the visual design language described on this page.
</Notification>

## Forms and angles

## Stroke alignment

Where possible always align strokes to a full pixel, for visual balance or to centre an icon or pictogram it can be necessary to break this rule.

<Grid2Cols>
  <Example 
    caption="Example where it's necessary to use half pixels to centre align the icon."
    imageSrc="./_images/stroke-alignment-1.png"
    darkWarning={false}
  />
  <Example 
    caption="To keep icon details visible, always leave a minimum of 1 pixel space between shapes."
    imageSrc="./_images/stroke-alignment-2.png"
    darkWarning={false}
  />
</Grid2Cols>

## Style

All our icons and pictograms are designed in a light outlined style, some icons will have a solid variant that can be used to clarify a state.

<Grid2Cols>
  <Example 
    caption="Outlined are the default style."
    imageSrc="./_images/style-1.png"
    darkWarning={false}
  />
  <Example 
    caption="A solid variant can be used to help clarify a state."
    imageSrc="./_images/style-2.png"
    darkWarning={false}
  />
</Grid2Cols>

## Sizes

All our icons are made in two sizes, 20 pixels and 24 pixels.

<Grid2Cols>
  <Example 
    caption="20 pixel canvas at 800% scale."
    imageSrc="./_images/sizes-1.png"
    darkWarning={false}
  />
  <Example 
    caption="24 pixel canvas at 800% scale."
    imageSrc="./_images/sizes-2.png"
    darkWarning={false}
  />
</Grid2Cols>

All our pictograms are either 64x64 pixels or 96x64 pixels.

## Icon specific guidelines

### Live area

Icons will in most cases live inside the live area.

<Grid2Cols>
  <Example 
    caption="16x16 pixel live area for 20 pixel icons."
    imageSrc="./_images/live-area-1.png"
    darkWarning={false}
  />
  <Example 
    caption="20x20 pixel live area for 24 pixel icons."
    imageSrc="./_images/live-area-2.png"
    darkWarning={false}
  />
</Grid2Cols>

### Safe area

In order to optically align some icons, you need to bring the safe area to use.

<Grid2Cols>
  <Example 
    caption="20 pixel icon."
    imageSrc="./_images/safe-area-1.png"
    darkWarning={false}

  <Example 
    caption="24 pixel icon."
    imageSrc="./_images/safe-area-2.png"
    darkWarning={false}
  />
  <Example 
    caption="In most cases, icons fit inside the live area."
    imageSrc="./_images/safe-area-3.png"
    darkWarning={false}

  <Example

### Naming

Name icon what they are and not what actions they can do, many icons can mean or be used for different things or actions.

<Grid2Cols>
  <Example 
    caption="Search or zoom? Call it what it is, a magnifying glass."
    imageSrc="./_images/naming-1.png"
    darkWarning={false}
  />
  <Example 
    caption="Email or letter? Call it what it is, an envelope."
    imageSrc="./_images/naming-2.png"
    darkWarning={false}
  />
</Grid2Cols>

### Keywords

Make it easier to find icons by adding searchable keywords, don't use product-specific keywords.

<Grid2Cols>
  <Example 
    caption="Keyword examples: alarm, bell, notification."
    imageSrc="./_images/keywords-1.png"
    darkWarning={false}
  />
  <Example 
    caption="Keyword examples: box, present, celebration, gift."
    imageSrc="./_images/keywords-2.png"

</Grid2Cols>

## Clean up

When your icon or pictogram is ready, remember to duplicate it before you outline it, this will make it easier if we have to make any updates later on. Make sure you only have one layer and name it Vector, to get the best svg output remove unnecessary vector points.

<Grid2Cols>
  <Example 
    caption="Example where all unnecessary vector points have been removed." 
    indicator="success"
    imageSrc="./_images/clean-up-2.png"
    darkWarning={false}
  />
  <Example 
    caption="When using flatten or outline stroke, unnecessary vector points may appear. Cleaning this up will give a better svg output."
    indicator="warning"
    imageSrc="./_images/clean-up-1.png"
    darkWarning={false}
  />
</Grid2Cols>

## Winding rules

One last but important step, you have to check how your winding rule are set, you can do that with the plug-in “Fill rule editor” here you want your icon or pictogram to be set to “non-zero rule”. If your icon are blue you a ready to go, if it's orange you are using the wrong winding rule. Click the orange area to change it to non-zero/blue.

When changing an icon or pictogram from even-odd to non-zero it is possible that you will see areas being filled instead of transparent, that's easy to fix. Click on the small black arrows to turn their direction. Two arrows going in the same direction will fill your object, and two arrows going in the opposite direction will make your object transparent.

<Grid2Cols>
  <Example 
    caption="To toggle between non-zero rule and even-odd rule simply click the blue or orange area of the icon."
    imageSrc="./_images/winding-rules-1.png"
    darkWarning={false}
  />
  <Example 
    caption="Fix this fill error by clicking the inner black arrows to turn their direction."
    imageSrc="./_images/winding-rules-2.png"
    darkWarning={false}
  />
</Grid2Cols>
